trial_identification.studytitle: Postprandial Lipid Metabolism in Familial Hypercholesterolaemia:Effects of Fish Oils
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of Fish Oil Supplementation on Postprandial Lipid Metabolism in Familial Hypercholesterolaemia

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other human genetics and inherited disorders

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - Fish oil capsule Treatment: drugs - HMG Coenzyme reductase
Active Comparator: Fish oil -
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - FH subjects with standard treatment (statin treatment)
Other interventions: Fish oil capsule 4g Omega capsule for 12 weeks
Treatment: drugs: HMG Coenzyme reductase All FH subjects are on standard statin treatment during study period

primaryOutcome.outcome: Postprandial changes in triglyceride-rich lipoprotein concentrations - Incremental area-under-the-curve (AUC) for triglycerides, apoB-48 and retinyl palmitate

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Triglyceride-rich lipoprotein kinetics - Kinetic studies of apoB48 and apoB-100 kinetics

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Patients with FH (genetically defined LDL-receptor mutation or Dutch score >8) on statin treatment only
- Hypertriglyceridaemia on a random blood sample (triglycerides >1.5mml/L)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Subjects with diabetes mellitus
- major systemic illness or use of steroids or other lipid-regulating drugs (such as niacin, fibrate and colesevelam)
- patients on hypocaloric diets or LDL apheresis; anaemia, haemorrhage and pregnancy.

recruitment.hospital: School of Medicine & Pharmacology,University of Western Australia - Perth

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: National Health and Medical Research Council, Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether fish oil supplementation is effective in the treatment of abnormal fat metabolism in subjects with elevated cholesterolaemia.
